result.execSummary:
The defendant Theresa L Cerruti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $50 fine plus costs. Fine/costs to be paid in full by 12/01/15 to avoid serving 15 days jail.

15 DAYS STAYED. If defendant pays fine and costs in full on or before 12/01/15, stay will be permanent. If defendant fails to pay fine and costs in full on or before 12/01/15, stay will be lifted and defendant will need to report to jail to serve the remaining 15 days. Good time and huber privileges granted. 60 days to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Theresa L Cerruti in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Theresa L Cerruti in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
No violent contact with G.T.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Theresa L Cerruti appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears in person.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.
